external_links.text: Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations
external_links.context: Health Canada has prepared a Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations , which elaborates on further details related to SFs. References to relevant sections of Health Canada's guidance document are included on this page.

external_links.text: Direct or indirect addition of supplemental ingredients
external_links.context: When a SF is used as an ingredient in another SF, the SIs in the first food are also SIs in the second food and not components [B.01.001(4), FDR]. The addition of the SIs to the second food must comply with the conditions set out in the List of permitted supplemental ingredients document incorporated by reference into the FDR. Refer to Direct or indirect addition of supplemental ingredients in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: List of permitted supplemental ingredients
external_links.context: The List of permitted supplemental ingredients includes all SIs permitted for addition to SFs, along with their conditions of use.

external_links.text: Supplemental ingredients and their conditions of use
external_links.context: For further information and examples on SIs and their conditions of use, refer to Supplemental ingredients and their conditions of use in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations.

external_links.text: Supplemented Food Facts table
external_links.context: Supplemented foods are required to carry a standardized SFFt. The required information, units and manner of expression are found in section B.29.002 and the table to section B.29.002 of the FDR. Supplemented Food Facts table in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations has more information on the elements within the SFFt.

external_links.text: Directory of supplemented food facts table formats
external_links.context: Refer to Health Canada's Directory of supplemented food facts table formats for acceptable SFFt formats including graphical requirements.

external_links.text: Small package exemption
external_links.context: Refer to Small package exemption in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information as well as the exceptions to this exemption.

external_links.text: Front-of-package nutrition labelling
external_links.context: Supplemented foods are subject to the same requirements and exemptions for the FOP symbol as other prepackaged foods. This includes a conditional exemption when they are sold in small packages [B.01.350(13.1), FDR]. Refer to Front-of-package nutrition labelling in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: Cautionary statements for supplemental ingredients
external_links.context: Refer to Cautionary statements for supplemental ingredients in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information on cautionary statements including how to calculate the maximum number of servings when required, and the use and grouping of cautionary statements advising against use by certain population groups.

external_links.text: List of permitted supplemental ingredients
external_links.context: Certain SIs, such as vitamin A (retinol), zinc, and L-asparagine, among others, are required to carry cautionary statement(s) at any amount declared. For more information, including the specific cautionary statement(s) required, refer to the respective line item in the List of permitted supplemental ingredients .

external_links.text: Supplemented Food Caution Identifier
external_links.context: Refer to Supplemented Food Caution Identifier in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: Claims not permitted for supplemental ingredients with an associated cautionary statement,
external_links.context: There are restrictions related to claims for specific SFs when they contain SIs with associated cautionary statements. This includes unique requirements for the use of general nutrient function claims, restriction of certain claims on SFs when the cautionary statement recommends against consumption by a certain age group, and claims on SFs with "high caffeine content" statement. Refer to Claims not permitted for supplemental ingredients with an associated cautionary statement, Claims not permitted on supplemented foods that are not to be consumed by a certain age group , and Claims not permitted on supplemented foods with the "High caffeine content" statement in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: Claims not permitted on supplemented foods that are not to be consumed by a certain age group
external_links.context: There are restrictions related to claims for specific SFs when they contain SIs with associated cautionary statements. This includes unique requirements for the use of general nutrient function claims, restriction of certain claims on SFs when the cautionary statement recommends against consumption by a certain age group, and claims on SFs with "high caffeine content" statement. Refer to Claims not permitted for supplemental ingredients with an associated cautionary statement, Claims not permitted on supplemented foods that are not to be consumed by a certain age group , and Claims not permitted on supplemented foods with the "High caffeine content" statement in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: Claims not permitted on supplemented foods with the "High caffeine content" statement
external_links.context: There are restrictions related to claims for specific SFs when they contain SIs with associated cautionary statements. This includes unique requirements for the use of general nutrient function claims, restriction of certain claims on SFs when the cautionary statement recommends against consumption by a certain age group, and claims on SFs with "high caffeine content" statement. Refer to Claims not permitted for supplemental ingredients with an associated cautionary statement, Claims not permitted on supplemented foods that are not to be consumed by a certain age group , and Claims not permitted on supplemented foods with the "High caffeine content" statement in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.

external_links.text: List of permitted supplemental ingredients
external_links.context: Additional representation exclusions for SFs containing certain SIs can be found in the List of permitted supplemental ingredients . For example, the use of caffeine as a SIs in some categories of SFs excludes those represented for physical performance.

external_links.text: Restrictions on size of acceptable claims for supplemented foods with a supplemented food caution identifier
external_links.context: There are size restrictions to be aware of on representations, such as claims, when a SF carries a SFCI. Refer to Restrictions on size of acceptable claims for supplemented foods with a supplemented food caution identifier in the Health Canada Guidance document: Supplemented Foods Regulations for more information.
